title: E-field of a uniformly charged rod

content.question: The very long rod shown in the figure has a positive charge uniformly distributed along its length. The magnitude of the electric field at a point outside of the rod a distance <math alttext="r sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from its axis is <math alttext="E sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the magnitude of the electric field at a distance <math alttext="5 r sub 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the axis of the rod?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
